welcome: My name is Luke Liukonen, and I am a developer, former educator, and tech enthusiast based out of the Metro Milwaukee Wisconsin area. Let's be honest though, that's only a small sliver of who I am. I've been in development for over 14 years professionally, spending most of my time in the travel space. My main focus is backend development, however, I have transitioned to more of a full stack developer. I have  been fascinated with the direction technology could take us, and was a huge fan of how we would interact with them in the future. To this day, I like to consider myself a technologist, reading up on current trends, and what progress we are making in the field.

highlights.a: 2-time Trisept Solutions representative for MMAC 'Be the Spark Tour'
Multiple time winner of Trisept Solutions Hack-a-thon competition
Represented Trisept Solutions at Microsoft bot Hack-a-thon
On multiple committees for outreach, wellness, and event planning
Developer lead on team for nearly 6 years
Adjunct Instructor for 2 semesters at ITT Technical Institute
Owasp top 10 trained. Maintained PCI complience

Hobbies.a: Tech, including gaming, PC building, Micro PCs like the Raspberry Pi
Sports including the Brewers, Packers, Bucks
Recently started riding a bicycle through state trails
I have been collecting memorabilia and autographs since I was a kid.

volunteer.a: Has worked at both the Schlitz Audubon and Urban Ecology Center helping plant trees
Running Folding@home to help battle Covid-19
Has run some kind of computer nearly non stop since 2014 for research through World Community Grid
